body: This bug will brake all the tests that are using arrays of objects in the fixture.

issue.title: [Bug]: Array with more than one entry is not propagated from fixture method

repository.name: playwright
repository.description: Playwright is a framework for Web Testing and Automation. It allows testing Chromium, Firefox and WebKit with a single API.

issue.body:
### Version

1.46

### Steps to reproduce

1. Clone: https://github.com/Lazar-Adrian/fixtureArray
2. npm i
3. npx playwright test

### Expected behavior

The object sent as a parameter on test.use() will keep it's same structure when called in a fixture method.

### Actual behavior

The property that has an {}[] type with more than one entry, will be set as {}[0] instead of {}[]

### Additional context

_No response_

### Environment

```shell
System:
  OS: macOS Sonoma 14.5
  CPU: Apple M1 Pro
Binaries:
  Node: v20.9.0
  npm: 10.1.0
npmPackages:
  @playwright/test: 1.46.0
```

issue.body:
### Last Good Version

1.44.1

### First Bad Version

1.47.1

### Steps to reproduce


1. Clone https://github.com/fanrita/issue.git
2. npm i
3. npx playwright test --project=chromium -g T-1
4. See error

### Expected behavior

test should pass

and in fixture arg should be 
e.g. 
 [{username: 'admin1', role: 'admin'}, {username: 'admin2', role: 'moderator'}];

### Actual behavior

test failed

and in fixture arg is {username: 'admin1', role: 'admin'}

### Additional context

_No response_

### Environment

```shell
System:
    OS: macOS 14.6.1
    CPU: (8) arm64 Apple M1
    Memory: 134.19 MB / 16.00 GB
  Binaries:
    Node: 20.5.1 - ~/Library/Caches/fnm_multishells/29083_1727356474480/bin/node
    Yarn: 1.22.17 - /usr/local/bin/yarn
    npm: 9.8.0 - ~/Library/Caches/fnm_multishells/29083_1727356474480/bin/npm
    pnpm: 8.9.0 - ~/Library/Caches/fnm_multishells/29083_1727356474480/bin/pnpm
  Languages:

  npmPackages:
    @playwright/test: 1.47.2 => 1.47.2
```
